cvv.description: The card security code. While this is not required, it is strongly recommended.

amount.description:
Total amount to be charged.
  
Format: `x.xx`

payment_token.description: The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) and is usable only once.

transaction_session_id.description:
A single use session ID used by Kount to link the transaction and Data Collector information together.

* Should be generated every time a payment form is loaded by the cardholder.
* Should be random/unpredictable (do not use sequential IDs).
* Should not be reused within a 30 day period.

This can be used with [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) or the Payment API when using the [Kount DDC with Gateway.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#gjs_methodology).

Format: `alphanumeric`

googlepay_payment_data.description: The encrypted token created when [integration directly to the Google Pay SDK](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#googlepay_variables).

tip.description:
The final tip amount, included in the transaction, associated with the purchase.
  
Format: `x.xx`

processor_id.description: If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (*processor_id* is obtained under Settings → Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

dup_seconds.description: Sets the time in seconds for duplicate transaction checking on supported processors. Set to *0* to disable duplicate checking.

descriptor.description: Set payment descriptor on supported processors.

descriptor_phone.description: Set payment descriptor phone on supported processors.

descriptor_address.description: Set payment descriptor address on supported processors.

descriptor_city.description: Set payment descriptor city on supported processors.

descriptor_state.description: Set payment descriptor state on supported processors.

descriptor_postal.description: Set payment descriptor postal code on supported processors.

descriptor_country.description: Set payment descriptor country on supported processors.

descriptor_mcc.description: Set payment descriptor mcc on supported processors.

descriptor_merchant_id.description: Set payment descriptor merchant id on supported processors.

descriptor_url.description: Set payment descriptor url on supported processors.

billing_method.description: Can be set to 'recurring' to mark payment as a recurring transaction or 'installment' to mark payment as an installment transaction.

billing_number.description: Specify installment billing number, on supported processors. For use when `billing_method` is set to "installment".

billing_total.description: Specify installment billing total on supported processors. For use when `billing_method` is set to "installment".

ipaddress.description:
IP address of cardholder, this field is recommended.
  
Format: `xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx`

country.description:
Card billing country. *Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2*.
  
Format: `CC`

drivers_license_state.description: The state that issued the customer's driver's license.

shipping_country.description:
Shipping country. *Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2*.
  
Format: `CC`

merchant_defined_field_1.description:
Merchant defined field. You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields.

Format: `merchant_defined_field_1=Value1`, `merchant_defined_field_2=Value2`, etc...

customer_receipt.description: If set to true, when the customer is charged, they will be sent a transaction receipt.

cardholder_auth.description:
Set 3D Secure condition. Value used to determine E-commerce indicator (ECI).
  
**Required for 3D Secure transactions**

cavv.description:
Cardholder authentication verification value.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

xid.description:
Cardholder authentication transaction id.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

directory_server_id.description:
Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
  
Format: `xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx`

source_transaction_id.description: Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Subscription or Customer Vault record. Must be set with a 'recurring' or 'customer_vault' action.

pinless_debit_override.description: Set to 'Y' if you have Pinless Debit Conversion enabled but want to opt out for this transaction. Feature applies to selected processors only.

recurring.description: **Recurring Field:** Recurring action to be processed.

plan_id.description:
**Recurring Field:** Create a subscription tied to a Plan ID if the sale/auth transaction is successful.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_payments.description:
**Recurring Field:** The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.

Note: Use '0' for until canceled

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_amount.description:
**Recurring Field:** The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.

Format: `x.xx`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

month_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'. 

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_of_month.description:
**Recurring Field:** The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'. For months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

start_date.description:
**Recurring Field:** The first day that the customer will be charged.

Format: `YYYYMMDD`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

customer_vault.description: Associate payment information with a Customer Vault record if the transaction is successful.

customer_vault_id.description: Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.

initial_transaction_id.description: **Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** Original payment gateway transaction id.

stored_credential_indicator.description:
**Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** The indicator of the stored credential.

Use **'stored'** when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use **'used'** when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

ccnumber.description:

cvv.description: The card security code. While this is not required, it is strongly recommended.

payment_token.description: The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) and is usable only once.

transaction_session_id.description:
A single use session ID used by Kount to link the transaction and Data Collector information together.

* Should be generated every time a payment form is loaded by the cardholder.
* Should be random/unpredictable (do not use sequential IDs).
* Should not be reused within a 30 day period.

This can be used with [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) or the Payment API when using the [Kount DDC with Gateway.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#gjs_methodology).

Format: `alphanumeric`

googlepay_payment_data.description: The encrypted token created when [integration directly to the Google Pay SDK](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#googlepay_variables).

tip.description:
The final tip amount, included in the transaction, associated with the purchase.
  
Format: `x.xx`

processor_id.description: If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (*processor_id* is obtained under Settings → Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

dup_seconds.description: Sets the time in seconds for duplicate transaction checking on supported processors. Set to *0* to disable duplicate checking.

descriptor.description: Set payment descriptor on supported processors.

descriptor_phone.description: Set payment descriptor phone on supported processors.

descriptor_address.description: Set payment descriptor address on supported processors.

descriptor_city.description: Set payment descriptor city on supported processors.

descriptor_state.description: Set payment descriptor state on supported processors.

descriptor_postal.description: Set payment descriptor postal code on supported processors.

descriptor_country.description: Set payment descriptor country on supported processors.

descriptor_mcc.description: Set payment descriptor mcc on supported processors.

descriptor_merchant_id.description: Set payment descriptor merchant id on supported processors.

descriptor_url.description: Set payment descriptor url on supported processors.

billing_method.description: Can be set to 'recurring' to mark payment as a recurring transaction or 'installment' to mark payment as an installment transaction.

billing_number.description: Specify installment billing number, on supported processors. For use when `billing_method` is set to "installment".

billing_total.description: Specify installment billing total on supported processors. For use when `billing_method` is set to "installment".

ipaddress.description:
IP address of cardholder, this field is recommended.
  
Format: `xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx`

country.description:
Card billing country. *Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2*.
  
Format: `CC`

drivers_license_state.description: The state that issued the customer's driver's license.

shipping_country.description:
Shipping country. *Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2*.
  
Format: `CC`

merchant_defined_field_1.description:
Merchant defined field. You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields.

Format: `merchant_defined_field_1=Value1`, `merchant_defined_field_2=Value2`, etc...

customer_receipt.description: If set to true, when the customer is charged, they will be sent a transaction receipt.

cardholder_auth.description:
Set 3D Secure condition. Value used to determine E-commerce indicator (ECI).
  
**Required for 3D Secure transactions**

cavv.description:
Cardholder authentication verification value.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

xid.description:
Cardholder authentication transaction id.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

directory_server_id.description:
Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
  
Format: `xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx`

source_transaction_id.description: Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Subscription or Customer Vault record. Must be set with a 'recurring' or 'customer_vault' action.

pinless_debit_override.description: Set to 'Y' if you have Pinless Debit Conversion enabled but want to opt out for this transaction. Feature applies to selected processors only.

recurring.description: **Recurring Field:** Recurring action to be processed.

plan_id.description:
**Recurring Field:** Create a subscription tied to a Plan ID if the sale/auth transaction is successful.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_payments.description:
**Recurring Field:** The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.

Note: Use '0' for until canceled

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_amount.description:
**Recurring Field:** The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.

Format: `x.xx`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

month_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'. 

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_of_month.description:
**Recurring Field:** The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'. For months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

start_date.description:
**Recurring Field:** The first day that the customer will be charged.

Format: `YYYYMMDD`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

customer_vault.description: Associate payment information with a Customer Vault record if the transaction is successful.

customer_vault_id.description: Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.

initial_transaction_id.description: **Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** Original payment gateway transaction id.

stored_credential_indicator.description:
**Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** The indicator of the stored credential.

Use **'stored'** when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use **'used'** when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

shipping.description:
**Level II/III - Order Field:** Freight or shipping amount included in the transaction amount. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

tax.description:
**Level II/III - Order Field:** The sales tax, included in the transaction amount, associated with the purchase. Setting tax equal to '-1' indicates an order that is exempt from sales tax. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

ponumber.description: **Level II/III - Order Field:** Purchase order number

orderid.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Identifier assigned by the merchant. This defaults to gateway transaction id.

shipping_country.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Shipping country (e.g. US).
 
Format: `CC` - ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

shipping_postal.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Postal/ZIP code of the address where purchased goods will be delivered. This field can be identical to the 'ship_from_postal' if the customer is present and takes immediate possession of the goods.

ship_from_postal.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Postal/ZIP code of the address from where purchased goods are being shipped, defaults to merchant profile postal code.

summary_commodity_code.description: **Level III - Order Field:** 4 character international description code of the overall goods or services being supplied. The acquirer or processor will provide a list of current codes.

duty_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Amount included in the transaction amount associated with the import of purchased goods. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

discount_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Amount included in the transaction amount of any discount applied to complete order by the merchant. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

national_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** The national tax amount included in the transaction amount. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

alternate_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Second tax amount included in the transaction amount in countries where more than one type of tax can be applied to the purchases. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

alternate_tax_id.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

vat_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Contains the amount of any value added taxes which can be associated with the purchased item. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

vat_tax_rate.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Contains the tax rate used to calculate the sales tax amount appearing. Can contain up to 2 decimal places, e.g. 1% = 1.00. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

vat_invoice_reference_number.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Invoice number that is associated with the VAT invoice.

customer_vat_registration.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Value added tax registration number supplied by the cardholder.

merchant_vat_registration.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Government assigned tax identification number of the merchant for whom the goods or services were purchased from.

order_date.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Purchase order date, defaults to the date of the transaction.

Format: `YYMMDD`

item_product_code_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Merchant defined description code of the item being purchased.

*Up to 99 sets of item_* fields are allowed.*

item_description_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Description of the item(s) being supplied.

item_commodity_code_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** International description code of the individual good or service being supplied. The acquirer or processor will provide a list of current codes.

item_unit_of_measure_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Code for units of measurement as used in international trade. Default - `EACH`.

item_unit_cost_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Unit cost of item purchased, may contain up to 4 decimal places.

item_quantity_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Quantity of the item(s) being purchased. Default - `1`.

item_total_amount_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Purchase amount associated with the item. Defaults to: 'item_unit_cost_#' x 'item_quantity_#' rounded to the nearest penny.

item_tax_amount_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Amount of sales tax on specific item. Amount should not be included in 'total_amount_#'. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_tax_rate_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Percentage representing the value-added tax applied. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_discount_amount_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Discount amount which can have been applied by the merchant on the sale of the specific item. Amount should not be included in 'total_amount_#'.

item_discount_rate_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Discount rate for the line item. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_tax_type_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Type of value-added taxes that are being used.

item_alternate_tax_id_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

Cardholder authentication verification value.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

xid.description:
Cardholder authentication transaction id.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

directory_server_id.description:
Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
  
Format: `xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx`

source_transaction_id.description: Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Subscription or Customer Vault record. Must be set with a 'recurring' or 'customer_vault' action.

pinless_debit_override.description: Set to 'Y' if you have Pinless Debit Conversion enabled but want to opt out for this transaction. Feature applies to selected processors only.

recurring.description: **Recurring Field:** Recurring action to be processed.

plan_id.description:
**Recurring Field:** Create a subscription tied to a Plan ID if the sale/auth transaction is successful.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_payments.description:
**Recurring Field:** The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.

Note: Use '0' for until canceled

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_amount.description:
**Recurring Field:** The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.

Format: `x.xx`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

month_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'. 

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_of_month.description:
**Recurring Field:** The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'. For months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

start_date.description:
**Recurring Field:** The first day that the customer will be charged.

Format: `YYYYMMDD`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

customer_vault.description: Associate payment information with a Customer Vault record if the transaction is successful.

customer_vault_id.description: Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.

initial_transaction_id.description: **Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** Original payment gateway transaction id.

stored_credential_indicator.description:
**Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** The indicator of the stored credential.

Use **'stored'** when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use **'used'** when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

shipping.description:
**Level II/III - Order Field:** Freight or shipping amount included in the transaction amount. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

tax.description:
**Level II/III - Order Field:** The sales tax, included in the transaction amount, associated with the purchase. Setting tax equal to '-1' indicates an order that is exempt from sales tax. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

ponumber.description: **Level II/III - Order Field:** Purchase order number

orderid.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Identifier assigned by the merchant. This defaults to gateway transaction id.

shipping_country.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Shipping country (e.g. US).
 
Format: `CC` - ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

shipping_postal.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Postal/ZIP code of the address where purchased goods will be delivered. This field can be identical to the 'ship_from_postal' if the customer is present and takes immediate possession of the goods.

ship_from_postal.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Postal/ZIP code of the address from where purchased goods are being shipped, defaults to merchant profile postal code.

summary_commodity_code.description: **Level III - Order Field:** 4 character international description code of the overall goods or services being supplied. The acquirer or processor will provide a list of current codes.

duty_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Amount included in the transaction amount associated with the import of purchased goods. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

discount_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Amount included in the transaction amount of any discount applied to complete order by the merchant. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

national_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** The national tax amount included in the transaction amount. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

alternate_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Second tax amount included in the transaction amount in countries where more than one type of tax can be applied to the purchases. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

alternate_tax_id.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

vat_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Contains the amount of any value added taxes which can be associated with the purchased item. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

vat_tax_rate.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Contains the tax rate used to calculate the sales tax amount appearing. Can contain up to 2 decimal places, e.g. 1% = 1.00. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

vat_invoice_reference_number.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Invoice number that is associated with the VAT invoice.

customer_vat_registration.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Value added tax registration number supplied by the cardholder.

merchant_vat_registration.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Government assigned tax identification number of the merchant for whom the goods or services were purchased from.

order_date.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Purchase order date, defaults to the date of the transaction.

Format: `YYMMDD`

item_product_code_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Merchant defined description code of the item being purchased.

*Up to 99 sets of item_* fields are allowed.*

item_description_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Description of the item(s) being supplied.

item_commodity_code_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** International description code of the individual good or service being supplied. The acquirer or processor will provide a list of current codes.

item_unit_of_measure_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Code for units of measurement as used in international trade. Default - `EACH`.

item_unit_cost_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Unit cost of item purchased, may contain up to 4 decimal places.

item_quantity_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Quantity of the item(s) being purchased. Default - `1`.

item_total_amount_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Purchase amount associated with the item. Defaults to: 'item_unit_cost_#' x 'item_quantity_#' rounded to the nearest penny.

item_tax_amount_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Amount of sales tax on specific item. Amount should not be included in 'total_amount_#'. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_tax_rate_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Percentage representing the value-added tax applied. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_discount_amount_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Discount amount which can have been applied by the merchant on the sale of the specific item. Amount should not be included in 'total_amount_#'.

item_discount_rate_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Discount rate for the line item. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_tax_type_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Type of value-added taxes that are being used.

item_alternate_tax_id_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

signature_image.description:
Cardholder signature image.
  
Format: `base64 encoded raw PNG image. (16kiB maximum)`

oneOf.title: Credit Card - Complete Partial Payment in Full

security_key.description: API Security Key assigned to a merchant account. New keys can be generated from the merchant control panel in Settings > Security Keys

type.description: Will complete a `payment_in_full` transaction that has not been collected in full. This allows industries that require `payment_in_full` but subsequently decide to still settle the transaction even though it has not been collected in full.

partial_payments.description: `payment_in_full`: Required that any split tendered transaction is collected in-full before settlement gets initiated.

partial_payment_id.description: Unique identifier returned when making the original transaction. This should only be used for secondary transactions.

ccnumber.description:
Credit card number.

<details>
<summary>Allowed Card Numbers:</summary>

| Card Type         | Test Card Number     |
|:------------------|:---------------------|
| Visa              | 4111111111111111     |
| MasterCard        | 5431111111111111     |
| Discover          | 6011000991300009     |
| American Express  | 341111111111111      |
| Diner's Club      | 30205252489926       |
| JCB               | 3541963594572595     |
| Maestro           | 6799990100000000019  |
</details>

cvv.description: The card security code. While this is not required, it is strongly recommended.

amount.description:
Total amount to be charged.
  
Format: `x.xx`

payment_token.description: The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) and is usable only once.

transaction_session_id.description:
A single use session ID used by Kount to link the transaction and Data Collector information together.

* Should be generated every time a payment form is loaded by the cardholder.
* Should be random/unpredictable (do not use sequential IDs).
* Should not be reused within a 30 day period.

This can be used with [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) or the Payment API when using the [Kount DDC with Gateway.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#gjs_methodology).

Format: `alphanumeric`

googlepay_payment_data.description: The encrypted token created when [integration directly to the Google Pay SDK](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#googlepay_variables).

tip.description:

**Level II/III - Order Field:** The sales tax, included in the transaction amount, associated with the purchase. Setting tax equal to '-1' indicates an order that is exempt from sales tax. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

ponumber.description: **Level II/III - Order Field:** Purchase order number

orderid.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Identifier assigned by the merchant. This defaults to gateway transaction id.

shipping_country.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Shipping country (e.g. US).
 
Format: `CC` - ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

shipping_postal.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Postal/ZIP code of the address where purchased goods will be delivered. This field can be identical to the 'ship_from_postal' if the customer is present and takes immediate possession of the goods.

ship_from_postal.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Postal/ZIP code of the address from where purchased goods are being shipped, defaults to merchant profile postal code.

summary_commodity_code.description: **Level III - Order Field:** 4 character international description code of the overall goods or services being supplied. The acquirer or processor will provide a list of current codes.

duty_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Amount included in the transaction amount associated with the import of purchased goods. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

discount_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Amount included in the transaction amount of any discount applied to complete order by the merchant. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

national_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** The national tax amount included in the transaction amount. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

alternate_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Second tax amount included in the transaction amount in countries where more than one type of tax can be applied to the purchases. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

alternate_tax_id.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

vat_tax_amount.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Contains the amount of any value added taxes which can be associated with the purchased item. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

vat_tax_rate.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Contains the tax rate used to calculate the sales tax amount appearing. Can contain up to 2 decimal places, e.g. 1% = 1.00. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

vat_invoice_reference_number.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Invoice number that is associated with the VAT invoice.

customer_vat_registration.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Value added tax registration number supplied by the cardholder.

merchant_vat_registration.description: **Level III - Order Field:** Government assigned tax identification number of the merchant for whom the goods or services were purchased from.

order_date.description:
**Level III - Order Field:** Purchase order date, defaults to the date of the transaction.

Format: `YYMMDD`

item_product_code_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Merchant defined description code of the item being purchased.

*Up to 99 sets of item_* fields are allowed.*

item_description_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Description of the item(s) being supplied.

item_commodity_code_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** International description code of the individual good or service being supplied. The acquirer or processor will provide a list of current codes.

item_unit_of_measure_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Code for units of measurement as used in international trade. Default - `EACH`.

item_unit_cost_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Unit cost of item purchased, may contain up to 4 decimal places.

item_quantity_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Quantity of the item(s) being purchased. Default - `1`.

item_total_amount_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Purchase amount associated with the item. Defaults to: 'item_unit_cost_#' x 'item_quantity_#' rounded to the nearest penny.

item_tax_amount_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Amount of sales tax on specific item. Amount should not be included in 'total_amount_#'. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_tax_rate_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Percentage representing the value-added tax applied. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_discount_amount_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Discount amount which can have been applied by the merchant on the sale of the specific item. Amount should not be included in 'total_amount_#'.

item_discount_rate_1.description:
**Level III - Line Item:** Discount rate for the line item. Default - `0.00`.

Format: `x.xx`

item_tax_type_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Type of value-added taxes that are being used.

item_alternate_tax_id_1.description: **Level III - Line Item:** Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

social_security_number.description: Customer's social security number, checked against bad check writers database if check verification is enabled.

signature_image.description:
Cardholder signature image.
  
Format: `base64 encoded raw PNG image. (16kiB maximum)`

security_key.description: API Security Key assigned to a merchant account. New keys can be generated from the merchant control panel in Settings > Security Keys

type.description: The type of transaction to be processed. Note that credits need to be enabled.

checkname.description: The name on the customer's ACH account.

account_holder_type.description: The type of ACH account the customer has.

account_type.description: The type of ACH account the customer has.

sec_code.description: The Standard Entry Class code of the ACH transaction.

amount.description:
Total amount to be charged.
  
Format: `x.xx`

payment_token.description: The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) and is usable only once.

transaction_session_id.description:
A single use session ID used by Kount to link the transaction and Data Collector information together.

* Should be generated every time a payment form is loaded by the cardholder.
* Should be random/unpredictable (do not use sequential IDs).
* Should not be reused within a 30 day period.

This can be used with [Collect.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#cjs_methodology) or the Payment API when using the [Kount DDC with Gateway.js](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#gjs_methodology).

Format: `alphanumeric`

googlepay_payment_data.description: The encrypted token created when [integration directly to the Google Pay SDK](https://secure.networkmerchants.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#googlepay_variables).

tip.description:
The final tip amount, included in the transaction, associated with the purchase.
  
Format: `x.xx`

processor_id.description: If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (*processor_id* is obtained under Settings → Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

dup_seconds.description: Sets the time in seconds for duplicate transaction checking on supported processors. Set to *0* to disable duplicate checking.

descriptor.description: Set payment descriptor on supported processors.

descriptor_phone.description: Set payment descriptor phone on supported processors.

descriptor_address.description: Set payment descriptor address on supported processors.

descriptor_city.description: Set payment descriptor city on supported processors.

descriptor_state.description: Set payment descriptor state on supported processors.

descriptor_postal.description: Set payment descriptor postal code on supported processors.

descriptor_country.description: Set payment descriptor country on supported processors.

descriptor_mcc.description: Set payment descriptor mcc on supported processors.

descriptor_merchant_id.description: Set payment descriptor merchant id on supported processors.

descriptor_url.description: Set payment descriptor url on supported processors.

billing_method.description: Can be set to 'recurring' to mark payment as a recurring transaction or 'installment' to mark payment as an installment transaction.

billing_number.description: Specify installment billing number, on supported processors. For use when `billing_method` is set to "installment".

billing_total.description: Specify installment billing total on supported processors. For use when `billing_method` is set to "installment".

ipaddress.description:
IP address of cardholder, this field is recommended.
  
Format: `xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx`

country.description:
Card billing country. *Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2*.
  
Format: `CC`

drivers_license_state.description: The state that issued the customer's driver's license.

shipping_country.description:
Shipping country. *Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2*.
  
Format: `CC`

merchant_defined_field_1.description:
Merchant defined field. You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields.

Format: `merchant_defined_field_1=Value1`, `merchant_defined_field_2=Value2`, etc...

customer_receipt.description: If set to true, when the customer is charged, they will be sent a transaction receipt.

cardholder_auth.description:
Set 3D Secure condition. Value used to determine E-commerce indicator (ECI).
  
**Required for 3D Secure transactions**

cavv.description:
Cardholder authentication verification value.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

xid.description:
Cardholder authentication transaction id.
  
Format: `base64 encoded` **Required for 3D Secure transactions**

directory_server_id.description:
Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
  
Format: `xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx`

source_transaction_id.description: Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Subscription or Customer Vault record. Must be set with a 'recurring' or 'customer_vault' action.

pinless_debit_override.description: Set to 'Y' if you have Pinless Debit Conversion enabled but want to opt out for this transaction. Feature applies to selected processors only.

recurring.description: **Recurring Field:** Recurring action to be processed.

plan_id.description:
**Recurring Field:** Create a subscription tied to a Plan ID if the sale/auth transaction is successful.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_payments.description:
**Recurring Field:** The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.

Note: Use '0' for until canceled

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

plan_amount.description:
**Recurring Field:** The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.

Format: `x.xx`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

month_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'. 

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_of_month.description:
**Recurring Field:** The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'. For months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

day_frequency.description:
**Recurring Field:** How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

start_date.description:
**Recurring Field:** The first day that the customer will be charged.

Format: `YYYYMMDD`

Required when **recurring** variable is set to `add_subscription`

customer_vault.description: Associate payment information with a Customer Vault record if the transaction is successful.

initial_transaction_id.description: **Stored Credentials (CIT/MIT):** Original payment gateway transaction id.

stored_credential_indicator.description:

Use **'stored'** when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use **'used'** when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

item_unit_of_measure_1.description: Code for units of measurement as used in international trade. Default: 'EACH'

item_unit_cost_1.description: Unit cost of item purchased, may contain up to 4 decimal places.

item_quantity_1.description: Quantity of the item(s) being purchased. Default: '1'

item_total_amount_1.description: Purchase amount associated with the item. Defaults to: 'item_unit_cost_#' x 'item_quantity_#' rounded to the nearest penny.

item_discount_rate_1.description: Discount rate for the line item. 1% = 1.00. Default: '0.00'

item_tax_type_1.description: Type of value-added taxes that are being used.

item_alternate_tax_id_1.description: Tax identification number of the merchant that reported the alternate tax amount.

customer_vault_id.description:
(Conditional - Customer Vault) The original customer_vault_id passed in the transaction request or the resulting customer_vault_id created on an approved transaction.

Note: Only returned when the "Customer Vault" service is active.

kount_score.description:
The Kount "Omniscore" indicating the level of risk on a given transaction. The higher the score, the lower the risk.

Note: Only returned when the "Kount" service is active.

post.description:
> ❗️ Never Use Real API Keys
>
> Never use real API Keys when testing. The gateway allows Partners to create Test Merchant Accounts. Testing should always use keys from the Test Accounts and never keys from a Standard Account.
<details>
<summary>Methodology</summary>

**Overview**

While our online reporting interface allows merchants to quickly and easily retrieve detailed information about past transactions, a need for additional flexibility may be required. For example, a merchant may have custom accounting software that requires up-to-date information about the settlement status of all credit card transactions every day.

This document describes how developers can query our reporting engine directly to retrieve transaction reports in a machine readable format. Once the data has been retrieved, it can then be parsed and imported into a variety of software applications.

**Communication**

The communication protocol used to send messages to the Payment Gateway is through the HTTP protocol over an SSL connection (HTTPS). The format you must use is name/value pairs delimited by ampersand.

| URL                                     | Example Post Data                                     |
|:----------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------|
| `https://secure.nmi.com/api/query.php`  | `security_key=security_key&transaction_id=123456789`  |

You should POST your request to the Query API. The name/value pairs that are accepted by the Payment Gateway can be found in the 'Variables' section of this API.

The Query API can be tested with live credentials or a dedicated test account only. Please contact your Merchant Service Provider for more information.

The Query API will respond in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC).

</details>

<details>
<summary>Example Response</summary>

**Query with no report_type or report_type "transaction"**

```xml
<nm_response>
    <transaction>
        <transaction_id>2612675976</transaction_id>
        <partial_payment_id></partial_payment_id>
        <partial_payment_balance></partial_payment_balance>
        <platform_id></platform_id>
        <transaction_type>cc</transaction_type>
        <condition>complete</condition>
        <order_id>1234567890</order_id>
        <authorization_code>123456</authorization_code>
        <ponumber></ponumber>
        <order_description></order_description>
        <first_name>John</first_name>
        <last_name>Smith</last_name>
        <address_1>123 Main St</address_1>
        <address_2>Apt B</address_2>
        <company></company>
        <city>New York City</city>
        <state>NY</state>
        <postal_code>10001</postal_code>
        <country>US</country>
        <email>johnsmith@example.com</email>
        <phone>1234567890</phone>
        <fax></fax>
        <cell_phone></cell_phone>
        <customertaxid></customertaxid>
        <customerid></customerid>
        <website></website>
        <shipping_first_name></shipping_first_name>
        <shipping_last_name></shipping_last_name>
        <shipping_address_1></shipping_address_1>
        <shipping_address_2></shipping_address_2>
        <shipping_company></shipping_company>
        <shipping_city></shipping_city>
        <shipping_state></shipping_state>
        <shipping_postal_code></shipping_postal_code>
        <shipping_country></shipping_country>
        <shipping_email></shipping_email>
        <shipping_carrier></shipping_carrier>
        <tracking_number></tracking_number>
        <shipping_date></shipping_date>
        <shipping>1.00</shipping>
        <shipping_phone></shipping_phone>
        <cc_number>4xxxxxxxxxxx1111</cc_number>
        <cc_hash>f6c609e195d9d4c185dcc8ca662f0180</cc_hash>
        <cc_exp>1215</cc_exp>
        <cavv></cavv>
        <cavv_result></cavv_result>
        <xid></xid>
        <eci></eci>
        <directory_server_id></directory_server_id>
        <three_ds_version></three_ds_version>
        <avs_response>N</avs_response>
        <csc_response>M</csc_response>
        <cardholder_auth></cardholder_auth>
        <cc_start_date></cc_start_date>
        <cc_issue_number></cc_issue_number>
        <check_account></check_account>
        <check_hash></check_hash>
        <check_aba></check_aba>
        <check_name></check_name>
        <account_holder_type></account_holder_type>
        <account_type></account_type>
        <sec_code></sec_code>
        <drivers_license_number></drivers_license_number>
        <drivers_license_state></drivers_license_state>
        <drivers_license_dob></drivers_license_dob>
```

security_key.description: API Security Key assigned to a merchant account. New keys can be generated from the merchant control panel in Settings > Security Keys

condition.description:
A combination of values can be passed and should be separated by commas. For example, to retrieve all transactions pending settlement or complete, the following could be used: `condition=pendingsettlement,complete`
Conditions | Condition | Description | |:-------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | pending | 'Auth Only' transactions that are awaiting capture. | | pendingsettlement | Transaction is awaiting settlement. | | in_progress | Three-Step Redirect API transaction has not yet been completed. The transaction
condition will change to 'abandoned' if 24 hours pass with no further action. | | abandoned | Three-Step Redirect API transaction has not been completed, and has timed out. | | failed | Transaction has failed. | | canceled | Transaction has been voided. | | complete | Transaction has settled. | | unknown | An unknown error was encountered while processing this transaction. |

transaction_type.description:
Retrieves only transactions with the specified transaction type.

<details>
<summary>Transaction Types</summary>

| Transaction Type  | Description                 |
|:------------------|:----------------------------|
| cc                | A credit card transaction.  |
| ck                | A check transaction.        |
| cs                | A cash transaction.         |

</details>

action_type.description:
Retrieves only transactions with the specified action types. A combination of the values can be used and
should be separated by commas. For example, to retrieve all transactions with credit or refund actions, use the following: `action_type=refund,credit`
Action Types | Action Type | Description | |:-------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | sale | Sale transactions. | | refund | Refund transactions. | | credit | Credit transactions. | | auth | 'Auth Only' transactions. | | capture | Captured transactions. | | void | Voided transactions. | | return | Electronic Check (ACH) transactions that have returned, as well as credit card
chargebacks. | | validate | Validated transactions. |

source.description:
Retrieves only transactions with a particular 'transaction source'. A combination of the values can be used
and should be separated by commas. For example, to retrieve all transactions with api or recurring actions, use the following: `source=api,recurring`
Sources | Source | Description | |:-----------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | api | API transactions. | | batch_upload | Batch Upload transactions. | | mobile | Mobile (iProcess) transactions. | | quickclick | QuickClick transactions. | | quickbooks | QuickBooks SyncPay transactions. | | recurring | Recurring transactions when using Recurring module. | | swipe | Swipe transactions. | | virtual_terminal | Virtual Terminal transactions. | | internal | Internal transactions. Typically indicates settlement. |

transaction_id.description:
Specify a transaction ID or a comma separated list of transaction IDs to retrieve information on.
Alternatively, provide a Subscription ID to retrieve processed (approved and declined) transactions
associated with it.

subscription_id.description:
Set a specific subscription record or comma separated list of records. Using this with a transaction search
will return all transactions associated with this subscription. This will return this subscription's payment/plan
information when used with `report_type=recurring`.

invoice_id.description: Set a specific Invoice ID. Should only be used when `report_type=invoicing`.

partial_payment_id.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified partial payment ID.

order_id.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified Order ID.

first_name.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified first name.

last_name.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified last name.

address1.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified specified address.

city.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified city.

state.description:
Retrieves only transactions with the specified state.
  
Format: `CC`

zip.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified zip/postal code.

phone.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified phone number.

fax.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified fax number.

order_description.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified order description.

drivers_license_number.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified driver's license number.

drivers_license_dob.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified driver's license date of birth.

drivers_license_state.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified driver's license state.

email.description: Retrieves only transactions with the specified billing email address.

cc_number.description:
Retrieves only transactions with the specified credit card number.
You can use either the full number or the last 4 digits of the credit card number.
**Note:** The last four digits in the test card number for Visa, MasterCard, and American Express are identical. In order to receive type-specific transactions, use the full test card number.

<details>
<summary>Allowed Card Numbers:</summary>

| Card Type                            | Test Card Number    |
|:-------------------------------------|:--------------------|
| Visa                                 | 4111111111111111    |
| MasterCard                           | 5431111111111111    |
| Discover                             | 6011000991300009    |
| American Express                     | 341111111111111     |
| Diner's Club                         | 30205252489926      |
| JCB                                  | 3541963594572595    |
| Maestro                              | 6799990100000000019 |
| Visa, MasterCard, & American Express | 1111                |
| Discover                             | 0009                |
| Diner's Club                         | 9926                |
| JCB                                  | 2595                |
| Maestro                              | 0019                |

</details>

merchant_defined_field_1.description:
Retrieves only transactions with the specified merchant defined field value.
Replace the '1' with a field number (1-20) (Example: `merchant_defined_field_12=value`)

start_date.description:
Only transactions that have been modified on or after this date will be retrieved.
Note that any actions performed on a transaction will cause the modified date to be updated.

Format: `YYYYMMDDhhmmss`

end_date.description:
Only transactions that have been modified on or before this date will be retrieved.
Note that any actions performed on a transaction will cause the modified date to be updated.

Format: `YYYYMMDDhhmmss`

report_type.description:
Sets the report type. * If you would like to query the Customer Vault to view what customer information is stored in the Customer Vault, you must set the customer_vault variable. * If you omit the customer_vault_id, the system will return all customers that are stored in the vault. * If you include a customer_vault_id, it will return the customer record associated with that ID. Example: `report_type=customer_vault&customer_vault _id=123456789`
Report Types | Report Type | Description | |:-------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | receipt | Will return an html receipt for a specified transaction id. | | customer_vault | Set the Query API to return Customer Vault data. | | recurring | Set the Query API to return subscription data. | | recurring_plans | Set the Query API to return plan data. | | invoicing | Set the Query API to return invoicing data. | | gateway_processors | Will return Processor details a user has permissions for. Specify a "user" by
querying with that security key. | | account_updater | Will return Customer Vault data that has been updated using the
Account Updater service. | | test_mode_status | Will return whether the account has test mode active or inactive. | | profile | Return merchant profile (company, email, address, timezone, defined fields,
gateway, favicon, status). It will also return card_schemes with
'processor_details' set to 'true' |

mobile_device_license.description:
Retrieves only transactions processed using the specified mobile device. * The device IDs for this parameter are available in the License Manager. * Use 'any_mobile' to retrieve all mobile transactions. * A combination of the values can be used and should be separated by commas. * Can not be used with 'mobile_device_nickname'. Example 1: `mobile_device_license=D91AC56A-4242-3131-2323-2AE4AA6DB6EB`
Example 2: `mobile_device_license=any_mobile`

mobile_device_nickname.description:
Retrieves only transactions processed using mobile devices with the specified nickname.

* The nicknames for this parameter are available in the License Manager.
* Can not be used with 'mobile_device_license'.

Example (URL encoded): `mobile_device_nickname=Jim's%20iPhone`

customer_vault_id.description: Set a specific Customer Vault record. Should only be used when `report_type=customer_vault`.

date_search.description:
Allows Customer Vault information to be returned based on the 'created' or 'updated' date.

* If you would like to query the Customer Vault to view when customer information was created or updated, you must set the report_type variable with the customer_vault value.
* If you omit the report_type variable, the system will ignore the date_search variable.

Example: `report_type=customer_vault&date_search=created,updated&start_date=20170101000000&end_date=20201231232359`

| Value    | Description                                                             |
|:---------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| created  | Will return Customer Vault data created during a specified date range.  |
| updated  | Will return Customer Vault data updated during a specified date range.  |

result_limit.description: Determines the maximum number of results that may return for the current query.

page_number.description: Determines which "page" of results are returned. For example, `result_limit=100&page_number=0` will return the first 100 results. Using `page_number=1` will return the next 100 results. Default - `0`.

result_order.description:
Determines order of in which results are returned. Default - `standard`.

<details>
<summary>Result Orders</summary>

| Result Order     | Description                                 |
|:-----------------|:--------------------------------------------|
| standard         | Returns the results from oldest to newest.  |
| reverse          | Returns the results from newest to oldest.  |

invoice_status.description:
Specify a comma separated list of what invoice statuses will return when using an "invoicing" report type.

Example: `invoice_status=open,closed,paid`

processor_details.description: Can be use with `"report_type"="profile"`, this will include merchant `"card_schemes"` in the response

CustomerVault.description: Retrieves customer profiles. Pass `customer_vault_id` parameter to filter by specific customer.

post.description:
> ❗️ Never Use Real API Keys
>
> Never use real API Keys when testing. The gateway allows Partners to create Test Merchant Accounts. Testing should always use keys from the Test Accounts and never keys from a Standard Account.
<details>
<summary>Usage</summary>
This request will create a new API key for a user on a merchant account. The request includes all key types, including those for the Payment API, Query API, Collect.js, and Collect Checkout.
</details>

<details>
<summary> Sending User ID</summary>
The `userId` is optional, and will default to the primary user on the account if it is not provided.

A full list of user IDs on merchant accounts can be queried via [Get Merchant or Partner User Info](#to-be-added).
</details>

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your v4 API key that was generated in the Partner portal.

parameters.name: gateway_id
parameters.description: The merchant ID that the request should operate on.

userId.description: The merchant user for whom to generate the API key. Optional and will default to primary user on the account if it is not provided.

description.description: Description associated with the new key.

permissions.description:
The permissions associated with the new key.

<details>
<summary>Permissions</summary>
Valid permissions and their restrictions are as follows:

| value            | description                                                                                                                        | restrictions                                                 |
|:-----------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------|
| transaction      | For use with Payment API, Payment Device SDKs, Customer-Present Cloud, Direct Connect SDK, Three Step Redirect API, and Query API  | Cannot be combined with `tokenization` or `collectCheckout`  |
| cart             | For use with QuickClick                                                                                                            | Cannot be combined with `tokenization` or `collectCheckout`  |
| tokenization     | For use with Collect.js                                                                                                            | Cannot be combined with `cart` or `transaction`              |
| collectCheckout  | For use with Collect Checkout (tokenization permissions are automatically added to these keys)                                     | Cannot be combined with `cart` or `transaction`              |

</details>

Create API Key.description: Creates a merchant key for use with various APIs

Create Collect Checkout Key.description: Creates a merchant key for use with Collect Checkout (includes Collect.js permissions automatically).

Create Collect.js Key.description: Creates a merchant key for use with Collect.js only.

objectType.description: The type of object that was created as a result of the request.

id.description: The ID of the merchant key that was created.

keyText.description: The value of the key to be sent in with API requests or passed into Collect.js. This can be accessed later in the Security Keys section of the Merchant's Settings.

userId.description: The merchant user ID associated with the key that was created.

description.description: The description assigned to the key. Matches that passed in the request.

permissions.description: The permissions assigned to the key. Matches those passed in the request except that `tokenization` will be added to `collectCheckout` keys automatically.

Create API Key.description: Creates a merchant key for use with various APIs

Create Collect Checkout Key.description: Creates a merchant key for use with Collect Checkout (includes Collect.js permissions automatically).

Create Collect.js Key.description: Creates a merchant key for use with Collect.js only.

post.description:
> ❗️ Never Use Real API Keys
>
> Never use real API Keys when testing. The gateway allows Partners to create Test Merchant Accounts. Testing should always use keys from the Test Accounts and never keys from a Standard Account.
<details>
<summary>Usage</summary>
This step simply creates the merchant account, getting their basic information into the gateway. After this step, you can add processors and value-added services before sending the welcome email to the merchant.

Note - you can board merchants under an existing sub-affiliate by providing a `parentAffiliateId` in the create request. This will add the merchant under the specified affiliate instead of the account making the request.
</details>

costPlan.description: The cost plan assigned to the merchant.

externalIdentifier.description: A description to further describe or identify the merchant.

lastTransactionDate.description: The date of the last transaction on the merchant.

parentAffiliateId.description: The ID of the affiliate directly above the merchant.

checkAba.description: The routing/ABA number used to bill the merchant.

checkAccount.description: The account number used to bill the merchant.

accountType.description: The type of bank account being used.

accountHolderType.description: The type of holder for the bank account being used.

features.description: A collection of various merchant feature flags.

forceTos.description: Whether or not the merchant is forced to accept the Terms of Service.

forceBillingAuth.description: Whether or not the merchant is forced to accept the Billing Auth.

allowBlindCredits.description: Whether or not the merchant is allowed to issue blind credits for Credit Cards.

allowBlindCheckCredits.description: Whether or not the merchant is allowed to issue blind credits for Checks.

advancedTransactionRouting.description: Whether or not the merchant has advanced transaction routing enabled.

sendBillingEmail.description: Whether or not the merchant receives an email for their billing.

braspag.description: Feature flags specifically related to the braspag processor.

advancedTransactionRouting.description: Whether or not the braspag processor has advanced transaction routing enabled.

verifi.description: Feature flags specifically related to the verifi service.

enabled.description: Whether or not the verifi service is enabled for the merchant.

viewBillingStatement.description: Whether or not the merchant can view their billing statement.

litle.description: Feature flags specifically related to the litle processor.

reportGroup.description: The merchant's litle report group. Returns false if not configured.

prePaidIndicator.description: The merchant's litle prepaid indicator. Returns false if not configured.

affluentIndicator.description: The merchant's litle affluent indicator. Returns false if not configured.

recycleAdvice.description: The merchant's litle recycle advice. Returns false if not configured.

campaign.description: The merchant's litle campaign. Returns false if not configured.

affiliate.description: The merchant's litle affiliate. Returns false if not configured.

merchantGroupId.description: The merchant's litle group ID. Returns false if not configured.

allowEmptyCcExp.description: Whether or not the merchant is allowed to pass empty Credit Card Expiration Dates.

pastDue.description: Whether or not the merchant's bill is past due.

apiReceipt.description: Whether or not the merchant's API transactions send receipts.

batchReceipt.description: Whether or not the merchant can batch receipts.

delinquent.description: Whether or not the merchant is in a delinquent state.

commercialCardIndicator.description: The merchant's commercial card indicator. Returns false if not configured.

customDescription.description: The merchant's custom description. Returns false if not configured.

apiAllowOnlyUsername.description: Whether or not the merchant can authenticate with the APIs using only a username.

orderIdDuplicateCheck.description: Whether or not the merchant has duplicate checking for the Order ID field.

cardLevelResult.description: The merchant's card level result. Returns false if not configured.

pmsalem.description: Feature flags specifically related to the pmsalem processor.

ignoreAmexCvv.description: Whether or not the merchant's pmsalem processor ignores the Amex CVV field.

allowNovusVerify.description: Whether or not the merchant's pmsalem processor can verify Novus cards schemes.

idInMdf11.description: Whether or not the merchant's pmsalem processor can pass the ID in MDF11.

credorax.description: Feature flags specifically related to the credorax processor.

bankNet.description: The merchant's bank net value for credorax. Returns false if not configured.

z5Risk.description: The merchant's z5 risk value for credorax. Returns false if not configured.

vantiv.description: Feature flags specifically related to the vantiv processor.

remainingBalance.description: The merchant's remaining balance for vantiv. Returns false if not configured.

prosa.description: Feature flags specifically related to the prosa processor.

deferredPayment.description: Whether or not the merchant has deferred payments enabled for the prosa processor.

cronopay.description: Feature flags specifically related to the cronopay processor.

customerId.description: The merchant's cronopay customer ID. Returns false if not configured.

post.description:
> ❗️ Never Use Real API Keys
>
> Never use real API Keys when testing. The gateway allows Partners to create Test Merchant Accounts. Testing should always use keys from the Test Accounts and never keys from a Standard Account.
<details>
<summary>Adding the Processor</summary>
This request submits the processor details for a specific merchant.
</details>
<details>
<summary>Add Value-Added Services</summary>
Value-added services (like Customer Vault) are added the same way as card/check processors, but they are far simpler requests.

Each VAS should be added in its own request, so if you wanted to make Customer Vault active, Invoicing active, and Mobile Payments offered, that would be 3 API requests to the `/api/v4/processors` endpoint.

### Request to Make Service Active
All fields are required, and it’s the `status` variable that’s telling this to be active right away. The `serviceId` value can be acquired using the `/api/v4/services/search` [documented here](checkservices).

As seen in the response, value-added services are technically “processors” so they return many values that you also see when adding a credit card processor, but most of this is not useful info for VAS. Important values here include:
* `id` is the unique identifier for this instance of the service
* `serviceId` is the code name for the service
* `status` will show “pending” until the merchant agrees to the fees/TOS, then it will be “active”
* `condition` will always be “offered” even after the merchant signs up

### Request to Make Service Offered
The only real difference is that in the response the `status` is now “inactive”.
</details>

patch.summary: Assign Fee Schedule to Merchant / Complete and Send Welcome Email
patch.description:
> ❗️ Never Use Real API Keys > > Never use real API Keys when testing. The gateway allows Partners to create Test Merchant Accounts. Testing should always use keys from the Test Accounts and never keys from a Standard Account.
Assign a Fee Schedule to the Merchant This can be done when creating the merchant in the first place (1. Create a Merchant) but you can also add it whenever you’d like using the request below. ### Assign Fee Schedule Request Please note this is a `PATCH` request. Attempting a `POST` will result in an error.
As noted above, the `costPlan` value can be passed in the initial merchant boarding step if you know what it will be at that point.
Complete & Send the Welcome Email This request will complete the merchant creation and send the welcome email to the merchant. `activatePendingServices` is optional, and is the equivalent of checking the “activate pending services immediately” box in the partner portal. ### Complete and Send Welcome Email Request This is a `PATCH` request, not a `POST`.
`activatePendingServices` is optional and defaults to false.
Note - `agreementTextId` is based on the agreement that is needed to be agreed to. You can pull the correct agreement language with a `/merchants/{id}/agreement_text` request. This will return the id and language that you are agreeing to.
